  "From": "news@prosrm.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c22562762.1075863357527.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "PROS Revenue Management, the world?s leader in pricing and revenue optimization science and software, invites you to attend PROS Pricing Optimization Web Seminar on Wednesday, November 14, 2001, from 2": "00 to 3:30 pm Central Time.",
  "Recently, a Wall Street analyst was quoted": "?By 2001, companies that neglect to implement yield management techniques will become uncompetitive.?  PROS Revenue Management solutions have been credited with delivering 6-8% incremental revenue and 20-100% incremental profits.   This Web seminar will allow industry leaders from virtually all industries to learn from the experience PROS has gained in over 15 years of deploying these solutions.",
  "Subject": "Maximize Profits, PROS Pricing Optimization Web Seminar",
  "This seminar is free of charge, but spaces are limited and will be available on a first come first served basis.  For more information, please check PROS? Web site at the following link": "http://www.prosRM.com/industries/pricing_optim_seminars_events.html, or send an email to PricingOptimization@prosRM.com. Interested participants will be contacted to receive conference access information.",
  "To": "rbuy@enron.com",
  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\RBUY (Non-Privileged)\\Buy, Rick\\Deleted Items",
  "X-From": "PROS Revenue Management \u003cnews@prosRM.com\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Buy-R",
  "X-To": "RBuy@enron.com",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": ""
}

  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 25 Oct 2001 17:59:16 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Email": "legatskim@asme.org",
  "Fax": "202.429.9417",
  "For additional information on these and other grant programs, go to http": "//www.whitaker.org/news/phaseout.html",
  "From": "capitol-news@list.asme.org",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c22730794.1075863357586.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Phone": "202.785.3756",
  "Subject": "Capitol Update ASME International October 24, 2001",
  "The Department of Education has announced 42 grants totaling $31 million to recruit mid-career professionals and recent college graduates for teaching careers. The grants, to be issued under the new Transitions to Teaching Program, will go to school districts, states or national organizations. Grantees must ensure that the recruits receive special assistance, guidance, support, and in some cases stipends and incentives, to make teaching a long-term career. Information on the funded projects is available at http": "//www.ed.gov/offices/OESE/",
  "To": "rick.buy@enron.com",
  "To change your personal information, or email address please click on the link below": "",
  "To view a copy of the report, go to http": "//www.defenselink.mil/pubs/qdr2001.pdf For additional information on DOD S\u0026T issues, contact Kathryn Holmes at 202.786.3756 or at holmesk@asme.org.",
  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\RBUY (Non-Privileged)\\Buy, Rick\\Deleted Items",
  "X-From": "Capitol News \u003ccapitol-news@list.asme.org\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Buy-R",
  "X-To": "Buy, Rick \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RBUY\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "",
  "You are currently subscribed to ASME's capitol-news list as": "rick.buy@enron.com",
  "http": "//www.ed.gov/PressReleases/10-2001/10052001e.html The Board will create a standard for teachers from non-traditional backgrounds to ensure that they will have credibility within the education system. The National Council on Teacher Quality is a nonprofit organizations affiliated with the Education Leaders Council and the Thomas B. Fordham Foundation.  For additional information, go to http://www.nctq.org/about.html",
  "https": "//www.asmeny.org/memberaddr/html/security.htm",
  "or click here": "http://www.asmeny.org/cgi-bin1/WEB400CE?+ANT007+N+99999"
}

  "In this edition of the e-newsletter from Handspring.com \u003chttp": "//r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.1661.7074.28465.3270.233.34125625\u003e...",
  "Last time, we talked about how the new Treo? communicator \u003chttp": "//r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.1661.7074.28465.3278.233.34125625\u003e lets you stay in touch when you just can't talk on the phone. This week we'll look at how it lets you surf the web-without wires.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c30659702.1075862187417.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Our FREE gifts makegreat stocking stuffers \u003chttp": "//r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.1661.7074.28465.3273.233.34125625\u003e\t   \u003chttp://4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif\u003e\tPick a Free Gift!",
  "Our task was to determine how many cars would make it through the intersection in one hour of green time (one hour of green time is the sum of the green times during each red, yellow, green phase until they total one hour). For this study, I downloaded a program SportsWatch v1.4 \u003chttp": "//r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.1661.7074.28465.3290.233.34125625\u003e onto my Handspring Visor Deluxe, which allowed us to record every car crossing, something that would have been impossible with a simple stopwatch. It allowed us to time the crossing of the rear axel for every car in the queue, since when you hit the 'lap' button, it records the time elapsed and outputs it as text. From here, it is a simple matter of copying the results to a memo in memo pad and saving.",
  "Please note that all special offers presented in the e-newsletter apply to the US and Canada only. {
  "ASME's Ohio Council, representing over 4300 ASME members in the state, has sent a letter to Ohio legislators urging support for S.B. 120, a bill that would significantly improve the state's civil justice system by limiting joint and several liability. The measure, currently under consideration by the Ohio House Civil and Commercial Law Committee, would ensure that a defendant would have to pay only its proportionate share of damages, for those defendants found to be 50 percent or less at fault.  To view of a copy of the letter, go to http": "//www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-41.html. For additional information on the bill, or on the Ohio Council, contact Gene Hulbert, ASME Ohio State Government Coordinator, at 614.882.0265 or hulbertL@asme.org.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 18 Oct 2001 07:42:49 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Earlier this month, Chairman Bingaman introduced legislation to amend the Reclamation, Recreation Management Act of 1992 to provide security for dams, facilities under the jurisdiction of the Department of the Interior's Bureau of Reclamation.  To view a copy of that bill, S.1480, go to http": "//thomas.loc.gov/ and search by bill number.",
  "Email": "legatskim@asme.org",
  "Fax": "202.429.9417",
  "From": "capitol-news@list.asme.org",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c10791348.1075863356941.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Phone": "202.785.7380",
  "Subject": "Capitol Update ASME International October 17, 2001",
  "The K-12 SMET Coalition, of which ASME's Council on Education is a member, has endorsed the legislation.  To view the letter, go to http": "//www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-42.html. For additional information, contact Patti Burgio at 202.785.3756 or at burgiop@asme.org.",
  "To": "rick.buy@enron.com",
  "To change your personal information, or email address please click on the link below": "",
  "To learn more about Export Alert!, go to www.nist.gov/public_affairs/releases/n01-05.htm.  Information on how to subscribe to the service is available at http": "//ts.nist.gov/ncsci. For more detailed information, contact Mark Bello at mark.bello@nist.gov or at 301.975.3776.",

  "As per our discussion, the first step was to identify the participants in the retention program. The next step is to build the business case for why these employees are critical and irreplaceable to your business unit. Please provided a brief rational for why these employees were selected. Additionally, if there is a unique situation or circumstance that makes your area more vulnerable, please included in an overall business summary. {
  "As you all know, the recruiting season is in full swing and the AA Program's recruiters are hitting campus as we speak.  One of the most important parts of the process and a key to Enron's future success are the Fantastic Friday and Super Saturday interview dates where we make the selections on those candidates who will receive offers from Enron for the 2002 recruiting class.  It is important that these candidates be interviewed by business leaders from each business unit and specifically those who utilize AA pool members.   "From": "Pua, Cornelio",
  "In August we were discussing the additional information needs that Corporate Development has re": "an electronic repository for the original models, pitch books, research, etc. on assets/deals, plus any current work Corporate Development, the business unit or RAC may have done.  Some of the information Corp Dev was interested in was financial data for each asset (EBITDA, NI, debt, etc.) that I think could be added to the PortRac system.  The remainder of the data Corp Dev was looking to have on hand electronically was to be part of a new livelink application that Cornelio was going to help develop.  The attached ppt file describes the user needs for this development project.",

  "Rick": "Recently I received an E-Mail that you and Louise Kitchen discussed my group's $544k allocation for 2002 to ENA and determined that it was incorrect and should be only $109k with the balance of $435k going to Kevin Garland's group.  Actually I did take into account the transfer of the merchant investments to Kevin's group in coming up with the $544 allocation.  For the last several years our allocation to ENA has been in excess of $1.1 million so it is less than one-half of historical levels.",
  "Subject": "Portfolio group 2002 Budget allocation to Enron Americas",
  "The $109k is definitely low considering the following services we perform for EA": "",

{
  "Cc": "'dburns@bakerbotts.ocm'",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 5 Oct 2001 10:51:50 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Mellencamp, Lisa",
  "I just returned from a meeting and had a voice mail from Marc Manly (NPW General Counsel) indicating they had a good meeting with Gene Lockhart this morning and were in the process of turning the document around.  The voice mail was left at 11": "35 am this morning.  Marc indicated he would try to E-Mail the documents (blacklined to show changes) to us in approximately 1 hour and suggested that after we skim the documents we get on a short conference call with him so he could walk us through NPW's thought process on why they made the changes (and not to negotiate the document on this call).  Marc indicated, for example, that they changed the daily requirement for reporting in Section 2(b) because from a practical perspective NPW could not meet this schedule.  He also indicated that much of their review had been focused on making sure from a practical perspective the documents worked.",

  "Subject": "Enron Net Works 2002 Budget Process",
  "The 2002 Enron Net Works budget will for the first time combine allocations to business units for four key services": "Enron Online, IT Infrastructure, Risk Management Operations and IT Maintenance and Development.  We are providing a level of detail for expense and capital spend that is greater than that provided in past years, and that will allow business units to make informed choices regarding the services that they receive.",
  "To": "raymond.bowen@enron.com, london.brown@enron.com, rick.buy@enron.com,",
  "We are meeting with individual business unit Offices of the Chair to review in detail the four service areas delivered through Enron Net Works.  Some of these meetings have been completed and more will occur between now and October 12.  Please keep the following points in mind as we work with you to finalize budget": "",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968",
  "Date": "Tue, 15 Jan 2002 07:06:12 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "announcements.enron@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c31298181.1075840382099.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "KOMP Horticultural - Sale of Leased Plants",
  "The KOMP Horticultural contract for the maintenance of leased floor plants has been cancelled.  Plant maintenance is not being performed on the leased plants in the Enron Building on floors 3 through 49.  Rather than removing the plants from the building, KOMP Horticultural has chosen to offer the plants to Enron employees for sale.  On January 16th from 11": "00 AM to 2:00 PM, KOMP will have a table on the south side of the plaza, by the up escalator, for those employees interested in purchasing a plant. At the time of purchase, KOMP will give a special sticker to place on the container of the sold plant (do not bring plants to the plaza for purchase).  Plants will not be allowed to be removed from the building unless they have the KOMP sold sticker on the container.",
  "The following guidelines must be followed": "",
  "To": "dl-ga-all_enron_houston@enron.com",
  "X-FileName": "richard buy 1-30-02..pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\rbuy\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Enron General Announcements \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=MBX_ANNCENRON\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "BUY-R",
  "X-To": "DL-GA-all_enron_houston \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=DL-GA-all_enron_houston_employees\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": ""
}

{
  "Bcc": "nicole.scott@enron.com, connie.blackwood@enron.com, jennifer.burns@enron.com,",
  "Below are a few points and a resume for your review": "",
  "Cc": "nicole.scott@enron.com, connie.blackwood@enron.com, jennifer.burns@enron.com,",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 8 Oct 2001 16:45:51 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "mike.mcconnell@enron.com",
  "Justification": "Jeff's capabilities in these areas make him extremely qualified. We rely on him heavily already, but at consulting rates he costs us more than $1.3mm per year and his focus is limited to technology. Most importantly, the lead commercial folks in the group are overburdened with administrative issues and spending too little time bringing in earnings.",
  "Management Committee Members": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c6088095.1075863379147.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Resume": "Currently the second most productive Partner at Diamond-Cluster, a technology consulting firm. He has been working at Enron for the last 2+ years, first for Tom Gros in EBS and Net Works and then for Dan Reck in Freight, developing trading systems.",
  "Subject": "Message from Mike McConnell and Jeff Shankman",
  "The Job": "We are looking to bring Jeff in as VP, Commercial Support.  The demands of growing the group require a consistent focus on technology, expenses, front and back office productivity, as well as constant re-analysis of growth strategies.",

{
  "Bcc": "nicole.scott@enron.com, connie.blackwood@enron.com, jennifer.burns@enron.com,",
  "Below are a few points for your review": "",
  "Cc": "nicole.scott@enron.com, connie.blackwood@enron.com, jennifer.burns@enron.com,",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 9 Oct 2001 08:01:04 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "mike.mcconnell@enron.com",
  "Justification": "Jeff's capabilities in these areas make him extremely qualified. We rely on him heavily already, but at consulting rates he costs us more than $1.3mm per year and his focus is limited to technology. Most importantly, the lead commercial folks in the group are overburdened with administrative issues and spending too little time bringing in earnings.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c8912033.1075863379396.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Resume": "Currently the second most productive Partner at Diamond-Cluster, a technology consulting firm. He has been a consultant dedicated to Enron for the last 2+ years, first for Tom Gros in EBS and Net Works and then for Dan Reck in Freight, developing trading systems.",
  "Subject": "Jeff Huff Resume",
  "The Job": "We are looking to bring Jeff in as VP, Commercial Support.  The demands of growing the group require a consistent focus on technology, expenses, front and back office productivity, as well as constant re-analysis of growth strategies.",

{
  "Americas": "IBIT increased 31% to $701 million.  Natural gas volumes increased 6% to 26.7 Tbtu/d, and power volumes increased 77% to 290 million megawatt hours (MWh).",
  "Broadband Services": "IBIT losses were $(80) million in the current quarter compared to a $(20) million loss last year.  This quarter's results include significantly lower investment-related income and lower operating costs.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968",
  "Corporate and other": "This segment includes the unallocated expenses associated with general corporate functions. This segment reported an IBIT loss of $(59) million compared to $(106) million a year ago.",
  "Date": "Tue, 16 Oct 2001 07:25:35 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Europe and Other Commodity Markets": "IBIT remained unchanged at $53 million as compared to last year.  While physical gas and power volumes increased, low volatility in these markets caused profitability to remain flat.",
  "Following are the highlights of our businesses": "",
  "From": "no.address@enron.com",
  "Global Assets": "This segment includes Elektro, Dabhol, TGS, Azurix and Enron Wind.  Third quarter IBIT remained unchanged at $19 million compared to last year.",
  "In addition, this quarter we announced one-time charges of $1.01 billion.  Over the past few quarters, we have conducted a thorough  review of our businesses and have decided to take certain charges to clear away issues that have clouded the performance and earnings potential  of our core businesses.  These charges include": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c22477855.1075863380868.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Natural Gas Pipelines": "IBIT increased slightly to $85 million in the third quarter.",
  "Portland General": "We reported an IBIT loss of $(17) million this quarter compared to IBIT of $74 million a year ago.  This loss is due to power contracts PGE entered into at prices that were significantly higher than actual settled prices during the third quarter.  Last week, we  announced an agreement to sell PGE to Northwest Natural.  This transaction is expected to close next year.",
  "Retail Services": "Enron Energy Services reported IBIT of $71 million, compared to $27 million a year ago.  So far this year, EES has completed more than 50 transactions with large customers and more than 95,000 deals with small business customers.",
  "Subject": "Third Quarter Earnings Results",
  "Transportation and Distribution": "",
  "Wholesale Services": "Total income before interest, minority interests and taxes (IBIT) increased 28% to $754 million in the third quarter.  Total wholesale physical volumes increased 65% to 88.2 trillion British thermal units equivalent per day (Tbtue/d).",
  "With our announcements this quarter we accomplished three things": "1) we showed continued strong earnings and earnings growth in our core businesses, 2) we cleared away those things that were clouding this superb performance in our core businesses, and 3) We expanded our reporting of financial results to increase transparency for our investors. To read the full earnings press release, go to www.enron.com/corp/pressroom/releases.",

{
  "As many of you remember, one of our RAC employees was flooded out of their house in June.  This flood severely damaged their house and ruined virtually all of their belongings inside the house.  Many of you generously donated cash, clothing, and toiletries which were immediately forwarded to the family.  Your generosity and responsiveness in their time of need was greatly appreciated.  They have been working hard to rebuild their house since June and are finally close to moving back home.  We are seeking your help again in donating ANY home furnishings you can.  Our goal is to collect as many items as we can.  If this family cannot use an item, maybe one of their neighbors can.  Here are some of the items we have collected so far": "",

{
  "\"Partnership for a Sustainable Future\" is the theme of the Sixth SPE International Conference on Health, Safety, and Environment in Oil and Gas Exploration and Production, 20-22 March, Kuala Lumpur. Planned are three plenary sessions, 14 panel sessions, 44 technical sessions, and one poster session. For more information and to register, visit http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_24800,00.html",
  "* \"Creative Solutions for Maturing Basins and New Frontiers\" is the theme of the SPE Asia Pacific Oil \u0026 Gas Conference and Exhibition, 8-10 October, Melbourne, Australia. Seeking paper proposals on gas technology, business uncertainty and risk, well construction, knowledge management, EOR, facilities optimization, management of maturing fields, reservoir characterization, case studies and other categories.  To see all of the categories and submit a paper proposal, visit http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_25172,00.html.",
  "* \"Technology for Tomorrow's Reservoirs\" is the theme for 2002 Europec, 23-25 October, Aberdeen. Areas of interest sought include deep water, individual technologies, subsea, construction, economic value of data, production optimization, risk management, well/reservoir modeling, and increasing recovery factors. View guidelines and the submission form at http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_108046,00.html.",
  "* \"Value Creation Through Appropriate Technology": "Transforming Opportunities into Realities\" is the theme of the IADC/SPE Asia Pacific Drilling Technology Conference, 9-11 September, Jakarta, Indonesia.. To explore possible paper proposal categories or to submit a paper proposal, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_25144,00.html",
  "* Case studies will be the focus of Off Well Site Decision Making, 22-23 April, Austin, Texas, U.S.A. Issues to be explored include offsite optimization of drilling operations - what works and what doesn't; integration of drilling and G\u0026G information; offsite monitoring and management of major rig equipment; offsite optimization of non-drilling operations, such as completions stimulation; offsite decision making as a way to leverage and share knowledge; and psychological and cultural issues involved in transferring part of rig decision making activity off site. http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_270287,00.html",
  "* Drilling, geological, petrophysical, and geomechanics engineers involved in petroleum well construction can benefit from Real Time Wellbore Stability, 20-21 May, Houston. Presenters will address limitations of current technology and future developments. http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_270517,00.html",
  "* E-Business in the Petroleum Industry, 2-5 June, Singapore, will focus in discussing the various applications of e-business for the industry, the implications in work processes and change management, obstacles and potential benefits for operators and service companies, current practices, developments, and future trends. http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_315201,00.html",
  "* Geomechanics Applications for Reservoir Exploitation, 28 April - 1 May, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia, is targeted to develop and enhance the understanding of each professional's role in the overall management of geomechanics in today's operating environment.  http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_286058,00.html",
  "* Post plateau and decline period in a field's life cycle curve is the focus of the third workshop on Field Management of Mature Reservoirs, 4-7 June, Scheveningen, The Netherlands. Discussions include technical challenges, best practices, case histories, risk management, and people management. Deadline for receipt of applications is 15 March 2002. For the workshop brochure and/or to submit an application please visit http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_341720,00.html",
  "* Production Enhancement, 21-24 April, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia, will focus on incrementally increasing production based upon case histories and working examples that include application of new and existing technology, automation-artificial intelligence, cost reduction, business partnerships, and statistical-analytical methods. http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_286329,00.html",
  "Are you an expert in your field? SPE's technical journals, the \"Definitive Technical Series,\" seek technical editors to contribute their expertise to SPE Journal, SPE Drilling \u0026 Completion, SPE Production \u0026 Facilities, or SPE Reservoir Evaluation \u0026 Engineering. Apply online at http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/shared/viewHtmlMaster/0,1565,1648_2312_8866,00.html",
  "As the largest and most diversified conference related to preventing, diagnosing, and remediating formation damage, the 2002 SPE International Symposium and Exhibition on Formation Damage Control, 20-21 February, Lafayette, Louisiana, U.S.A., will offer sessions designed to bridge the tasks expected of reservoir, drilling, production, and geological professionals. Find out more at http": "//www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_22089,00.html",

  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 9 Jan 2002 12:19:50 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "richardson@copn.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c14127028.1075840383187.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mike Peterson asked me to send you the following note, with attached order": "",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "PRIVILEGED AND CONFIDENTIAL": "",
  "Subject": "Judge Rosenthal's Order entered this morning",
  "To": "cliff.baxter@enron.com, rick.buy@enron.com, richard.causey@enron.com,",
  "X-FileName": "richard buy 1-30-02..pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\rbuy\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Richardson, Terri \u003crichardson@copn.com\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "BUY-R",
  "X-To": "Baxter, Cliff \u003cjcbax1@aol.com\u003e, Buy, Rick \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RBUY\u003e, Causey, Richard \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RCAUSEY\u003e, Frevert, Mark \u003cmfrevert@hotmail.com\u003e, Hirko, Joe \u003cjoehirko@aol.com\u003e, Horton, Stanley \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=SHORTON\u003e, Kean, Steven \u003csteve_kean@kindermorgan.com\u003e, Koenig, Mark \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=MKOENIG\u003e, McConnell, Mike \u003cmike_s_mcconnell@hotmail.com\u003e, McMahon, Jeffrey \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=JMCMAHO\u003e, Metts, Mark \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=MMETTS\u003e, Olson, Cindy \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=COLSON\u003e, Pai, Lou \u003ckowens@loupai.com\u003e, Rice, Ken \u003ckrice@rvtcapital.com\u003e, Sutton, Joe \u003cjsutton@suttonventures.com\u003e, Williams, Robert C. \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RWILLIA2\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "Williams, Robert C. \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RWILLIA2\u003e, Brownfeld, Gail \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=GBROWNF\u003e",
  "You might take further comfort from two additional points in the Court's opinion": "(a) at several places, the Court clearly indicates that any \"freeze\" or other such injunctive relief as to any defendant would have to be predicated on an individualized evidentiary showing as to that defendant; and (b) the Court indicates that plaintiffs would have to satisfy a very difficult \"tracing\" requirement to establish a right to a constructive trust or freeze (i.e., \"trace\" a specific asset or fund of money held by any defendant back to the profits of an improper insider trade)."
}

  "Subject": "Organizational Announcement",
  "The Creditors' Committee was formed last week by the United States Trustee.  This committee is comprised of 15 individuals representing various creditor groups including": "banks, bondholders, insurance companies and employees.  The Creditors' Committee will be the key point of contact as we reorganize the company and emerge from Chapter 11.  Initially, they will send financial advisors to our offices to monitor any asset liquidations as well as review our cash flow projections.  Ultimately, they will be responsible for approving our reorganization plan as to which assets or businesses we sell and which ones we retain.",
  "To": "dl-ga-all_enron_worldwide4@enron.com",
  "Unfortunately, due to the current financial condition of the company, the following members of the management committee have left the company or will be leaving the company by the end of December": "",

  "A few more details ................   Again, most of the EGA companies' ownership trail includes all Enron ownership through a number of Enron entities.  Through further research, we found a few more that don't totally fit that mold": "",
  "Bcc": "naomi.connell@enron.com, hardie.davis@enron.com, paula.rieker@enron.com,",
  "Cc": "naomi.connell@enron.com, hardie.davis@enron.com, paula.rieker@enron.com,",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 5 Dec 2001 11:39:00 -0800 (PST)",
  "EA": "ECT Non U.S. Payroll Company (there is no such entity, but I would assume these folks are paid by ENA)",
  "EBS": "Broadband Solutions Pvt. Ltd. (actually comes up to Corp. through a long complicated chain of companies associated with Atlantic Commercial Finance)",
  "EEOS": "Enron Engineering \u0026 Construction and the former NEPCO are both organized under EESO whose ownership remains Enron Corp.",
  "EES": "Enron Direct LTD Partnership is actually an Enron North America entity",
  "EGA": "Here's where the going gets tough because the vast majority of these Enron Global Assets entities have very complicated organization structures with",
  "EIM": "No Stadacona Paper Company but it  is probably Compagnie Papier Stadaconda which is owned in a complicated structure through a Netherlands EIM",
  "ENW": "Enron Net Works, LLC is a wholly owned Enron Corp. company",
  "EP": "Enron Oil \u0026 Gas India Ltd., for instance, is owned by Enron Asst Holdings, which is owned by Enron Finance Partners, which is part of a complex ownership",
  "EWC": "The Enron Wind Group is all part of Enron Renewable Energy Corp. which is owned by Smith Street Land Co., an Enron Corp. company, but many of the",

  "Based on information that we have recently obtained, Enron and its auditors determined that certain off-balance sheet entities should have been included in Enron's consolidated financial statements pursuant to generally accepted accounting principles.  As a result, Enron will restate its financial statements from 1997 to 2000 and for the first and second quarters of 2001.  These restatements have no material effect on Enron's current financial position.  Here are some details included in the filing": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 8 Nov 2001 15:35:50 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "chairman.ken@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c17273057.1075862190847.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Net income for each period will be impacted by the retroactive consolidation of Joint Energy Development Investments (JEDI) and Chewco beginning in November 1997, the consolidation of an LJM1 subsidiary for 1999 and 2000 and prior year proposed audit adjustments.  Enron's current assessment indicates that the restatement will include": "",
  "Subject": "SEC Information/Earnings Restatement",
  "The information provides further details about": "",

  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",

  "X-From": "Ken Lay - Office of the Chairman \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=MBX_KLAYOFFICECHAIR\u003e",

  "X-To": "DL-GA-all_enron_worldwide \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=DL-GA-all_enron_worldwide\u003e",

  "\u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flosensing?y=MSR0DERSw0CjEp\u003e",
  "Bank credit processes must be up to scratch if a bank is to retain control over credit quality in its loan portfolios. In \"Bank Credit Processes and Operational Risk\", an exclusive new feature \u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0B4W0Av\u003e for ERisk, Becky Walzak of Boston Portfolio Advisors looks at what can go wrong, explores the increasing cost of failed deals on the secondary credit markets, and offers a solution based on ideas within the Basle II regulatory capital reform proposals.",
  "Check out our featured Book of the Month. Operational Risk - Measurement and Modelling, by Jack King, is one of the first books dedicated to the cutting-edge problem of modelling bank operational risk. We review it, and you can order it online through our site. Also available in the ERisk Bookstore \u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0B4Y0Ax\u003e, books on a wide variety of risk management topics, including credit risk, operational risk, enterprise risk and financial debacles.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 9 Nov 2001 10:12:31 -0800 (PST)",
  "For technical support queries, please email support@erisk.com \u003cmailto": "support@erisk.com\u003e",
  "From": "ERisk [mailto:ERisk@email.eRisks.com]",
  "In this week's round-up \u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0bNX0Au\u003e of economic, banking and P\u0026C insurance news from an enterprise risk management perspective: global rate cuts boost markets, but economic news continues to be gloomy; Enron faces takeover by competitor; the strange case of the mystery credit crunch; tough times for the mortgage industry; legal action continues over World Trade Center claims.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c24215380.1075862190924.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "More than 17,000 risk professionals receive this email every week. To find out how your message could reach them, mail us at info@erisk.com \u003cmailto": "%20info@erisk.com\u003e",
  "Sent": "Friday, November 09, 2001 11:33 AM",
  "Still available": "Fooled by Randomness \u003chttp://email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0bNa0A4\u003e, by Nassim Taleb",
  "Subject": "ERisk Essentials",
  "The ERisk Essentials is published every Friday by ERisk.com \u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0B4Z0Ay\u003e.",
  "The massive scale of claims arising from September 11 has worried many in the P\u0026C insurance market, but harder rates should benefit those who are strong enough to take advantage of them.   "To": "Schneider, Chip",
  "To be reminded of your password, or to reset it, follow this link \u003chttp": "//email.eRisks.com/cgi-bin10/flo?y=hMSR0DERSw0CjE0B6R0As\u003e.",

  "Will Dynegy clinch a cut-rate acquisition of its troubled arch-rival, Enron? {
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 9 Nov 2001 15:56:33 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "chairman.ken@enron.com",
  "I know you have a lot of questions about this transaction and about next steps.  We have a list of frequently asked questions posted at \u003chttp": "//home.enron.com/updates/\u003e.  If you have additional questions, please submit them to questions@enron.com \u003cmailto:questions@enron.com\u003e.  We will post updates as soon as we have answers to your questions.  If you receive any calls from the media, please refer them to our media team at (713) 853-5670.",
  "Investors and security holders are urged to carefully read the joint proxy statement/prospectus regarding the proposed transactions when it becomes available, because it will contain important information.  Investors and security holders may obtain a free copy of the joint proxy statement/prospectus (when it is available) and other documents containing information about Dynegy and Enron, without charge, at the SEC's web site at www.sec.gov.  Copies of the joint proxy statement/prospectus and the SEC filings that will be incorporated by reference in the joint proxy statement/prospectus may also be obtained for free by directing a request to either": "Investor Relations, Dynegy Inc., 1000 Louisiana, Suite 5800, Houston, TX 77002, Phone:  (713) 507-6400, Fax:  (713) 507-6808; or Investor Relations, Enron Corp., 1400 Smith Street, Houston, TX 77002, Phone:  (713) 853-3956, Fax:  (713) 646-3002.",

  "Phone": "(713) 853-1575",
  "Subject": "Legal Risk Memo -- sale of Enron interest in UtiliQuest",
  "The legal risks discussed in this memo were also set forth in the DASH; however, please note the following correction to the DASH": "while the Enron entities' pro rata share of the maximum potential liability under the seller indemnity is $20.7 million, Enron and the other sellers have joint and several liability for indemnification obligations which are capped at $30 million, and Enron will be liable for the entire $30 million if the non-Enron sellers cannot satisfy their pro rata share of the liability under the seller indemnity (note that Enron is not guaranteeing or backstopping the other sellers' share of this liability in any way; however, the purchaser may choose to hold Enron liable for the entire liability, and leave Enron to pursue the other sellers for their share).",
  "To": "kevin.kuykendall@enron.com, kevin.garland@enron.com, e..haedicke@enron.com,",
  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",

{
  "Bcc": "cassandra.schultz@enron.com, rebecca.phillips@enron.com,",
  "Cc": "cassandra.schultz@enron.com, rebecca.phillips@enron.com,",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 1 Aug 2001 10:52:53 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Enron's Leadership Campaign kicked-off on July 23 and is well underway.  As you know, participation by Enron's executive team is vital to the success of the campaign.  To make your contribution, please click on http": "//cr.enron.com/unitedway.  Thank you for making a difference.",
  "For the 3AC crowd, a group will be meeting at the elevators on 3AC14 to walk over to the Crown Plaza at 3": "20pm.  I encourage the EB folks to the do the same on EB28.",
  "From": "chip.schneider@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c7476752.1075863365095.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Outside Directions": "Proceed south on Smith St. to Pease St. and cross through the light.   The Crowne Plaza is located on the right.  Proceed to 2nd floor to the Bluebonnet Ballroom.",
  "Please RSVP to Zulie Flores at extension 3-3908 or via e-mail by 5": "00 p.m. today.  If you have already replied, thank you for your response.  I look forward to seeing you on Wednesday.",
  "Subject": "REMINDER-Leadership Reception",
  "The reception will be held at the new Crowne Plaza Hotel, located down the street at 1700 Smith St. on Wednesday, August 1 from 3": "30 to 4:30 p.m.  We will be in the Bluebonnet Ballroom.  (See walking directions below.)",

{
  "-------------- Forwarded by Janet R Dietrich/HOU/EES on 08/10/2001 03": "41 PM ---------------------------",
  "---------------------- Forwarded by David W Delainey/HOU/EES on 08/10/2001 11": "03 AM ---------------------------",
  "08/10/2001 11": "06 AM",
  "After reviewing the Doorstep audit at Long Beach with the team I have the following conclusion": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Fri, 10 Aug 2001 15:53:34 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Rick Buy/ENRON@enronXgate on 08/10/2001 10:53 AM",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c16657398.1075863365722.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "Remote Offices- Suggestions",
  "The doorstep audit is not yet complete as I'm having about 25 or so deals \"tested\" out of the Long Beach office. We should know all final results within the next week or so. Rick-your suggestions are generally on target as we have already begun the process for pulling each specific office's information together-ie": "how many offices do we have, who are the specific people in them, what do they transact on (DSM, gas/power commodity, services mgmt., etc), and can we consolidate/minimize the number of offices we have.  For example, of the 87-ish offices that we currently have EES folks in, only 14 of those offices have individuals that transact gas or power deals in the EnronDirect sales group (ie:  customers below $10 million in energy spend) and there are @ 45 sales folks in these 14 offices.",
  "To": "David W Delainey/HOU/EES@EES, Janet R Dietrich/HOU/EES@EES",
  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\RBUY (Non-Privileged)\\Buy, Rick\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Dietrich, Janet \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=NOTESADDR/CN=384ECA1E-36846EF5-62569FB-57DCF1\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Buy-R",
  "X-To": "Buy, Rick \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RBUY\u003e, Delainey, David \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=NOTESADDR/CN=28FC501B-22D3A001-62569FB-57CAAA\u003e, Leff, Dan \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=NOTESADDR/CN=9BB28634-F7B2062D-862564DE-77878A\u003e, Lavorato, John \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=JLAVORA\u003e",

  "cc": "John J Lavorato/ENRON@enronXgate"

  "Subject": "Suggested text for message on EES meeting",
  "The weekly EES/EWS meeting with Rick Causey, Rick Buy and Dan Leff on Thursdays from 3": "00 - 4:00 pm in EB3321 is being revamped to insure that the agenda and format for the meeting are organized to maximize the benefit from these recurring meetings.  In reviewing the availability of key players over the next several weeks and to allow time to create meaningful tracking documents for critical milestones, the Thursday meetings will be cancelled from now through the first week in September.  The meeting will resume beginning Thursday, September 13 from 3:00 to 4:00 and will be held every other week from that point forward.   You will be notified prior to the resumption of these meetings in September if you need to put this on your calendar as a recurring meeting.  The list of attendees is being reviewed, with the possibility of reducing the number of attendees in an effort to utilize people's time wisely and to create an atmosphere for frank dialogue regarding progress.",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968",
  "Date": "Wed, 15 Aug 2001 23:04:12 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Effective Saturday, August 18, you must replace the first digit 7 with an 8 when accessing the tie lines.  Additionally, several of the digits to the London, Calgary, and Portland tie lines have changed.  All other digits of existing access codes will remain the same.  For your reference, a list of the new dial strings for remote locations is identified at the bottom of this message.   "1\tLimits. Here's how I interpreted the BOD approvals": "",
  "At Business Unit level the individual commodity limits are unchanged, and I have put limits over the Business Units themselves as follows": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",

  "- capture option exposure ASAP or prohibit option trading": "PGE has an option trade in the books that is not captured in the risk management and reporting \t\t\tframework (position, P\u0026L and VaR)",
  "- develop processes for capturing other exposures": "",
  "- reliability issues": "PGE has significant political and financial repercussions for being caught short in a blackout",
  "1. Design decision authority process for significant business decisions. In retrospect, it would be helpful to analyze the value of the long position against the cost of reliability and make a decision accordingly. Other examples": "should PGE apply for a PCA mechanism past 2002, should PGE be purchasing power for 2003-2004. Also, participate regularly in the PGE Risk Management Committee meetings.",
  "3. Daily reporting of PGE risks": "VaR, Positions and P\u0026L, notifications of limit violations; as well as, notification of important transactions (purchase of 2003-2004 power)",

  "(3) Both authorizations should be based on": "",
  "(iii) a list of requirements prepared by RAC setting out": "",
  "As you are aware, we are increasingly being asked by traders/originators to clarify our views on doing business in sub-investment grade countries.  Recent quieries have focused particularly on power deals in the Balkans (Bosnia, Macedonia, etc.) and metal deals in countries ranging from Uzbekistan to Vietnam.  In order to give them the kind of guidelines they need, I would like to be able to use the recently prepared table of conforming/not recommended/non conforming countries.   "From": "cassandra.schultz@enron.com",
  "Key Points re": "the Limit Structure",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c12668373.1075863368878.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Risk Management Benefits of Limit Structure": "1) CEO flexibility below the Concentration Limit level, and 2) individual Enron Business Units have clearly defined trading authority, enabling the Risk Management Committee to authorize business units to trade in the same commodities while strengthening risk management practices to facilitate compliance with the Board approved Concentration Limits",
  "Subject": "Market Risk Management Changes under New Risk Management Policy",
  "The Enron Corp. Board of Directors approved a new Risk Management Policy (the \"Policy\") on August 14, 2001, and notice has been distributed to Enron employees to announce the posting of this policy on the Enron intranet website at http": "//home.enron.com/resources (without market risk limits due to confidentiality).  The Policy includes a three page Executive Summary providing an overview of risk management practices for the four major types of risks addressed: (a) market risk; (b) credit risk; (c) operational risk and (d) liquidity/funding risk, and this summary is attached to this e-mail for your convenience.  The credit policy was incorporated without change, and the Transaction Approval Process and Guarantee Approval Processes were also incorporated with updating for specific approval authorities.",

{
  "1.  VaR": "Given that PGE is a naturally short utility and does not hedge its long-dated gas position for regulatory, liquidity and market view reasons, I propose that PGE reallocate $500k of its regulated electric VaR to its regulated natural gas VaR bring the gas VaR up to $2.5MM and reducing the electric VaR to $7.5mm.  This change is necessary to account for the size of PGE's natural short position in the back-end of its reporting period. After reducing PGE's electric VaR it will still have sufficient capacity to manage the regulated electric portfolio.",
  "2. NOP": "After changing PGE's regulated gas VaR to $2.5MM it will be necessary to change the corresponding net open position.  Currently PGE has been using a 10 Bcf limit for its NOP and Maturity Gap.  Using a $2.5MM VaR I've recalculated  the corresponding NOP/Maturity limit to be approximately 17 Bcf.",

  "In this edition of the e-newsletter from Handspring.com \u003chttp": "//r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2270.11440.44877.4925.233.34125625\u003e...",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c21482160.1075840381220.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Module Tip": "Audible Advisor",
  "On Christmas Day Jenny started having contractions. We used her Visor and the Labor Timer to monitor the contractions but that was not to be the day. Again on the 29th she had contractions and again no baby. However, throughout the day on New Years Eve her contractions were very consistent. That night after we rang in the New Year she felt very strongly that this might be the night. As I went to sleep Jenny used her Visor and the Labor Timer to keep track of her contractions. At 4 a.m. she said it was time to head for the hospital. Throughout the wee hours of the morning I used my Visor Edge to keep track of the contractions as we paced the halls of the hospital. The staff was impressed at how I was able to keep such accurate details as we roamed up and down the halls of Labor and Delivery. I fessed up and showed them the program running on my Visor. At 12": "51 p.m. January 1st our daughter Zoe Grace was born. I am happy to report Mom, Zoe and Dad are all doing great.",

{
  "Cc": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 30 Aug 2001 14:23:04 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Carson, Rick L.",
  "Hi Rick": "I noticed that you were online.  Have you had an opportunity to look at the budget numbers.  Corp called and wanted to get them so they could start building their spreadsheets for the Lay presentation.  They said we could still revise it up to Friday.  I wanted to get your ok to send the numbers to them.  Thanks   Rick C.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c18832569.1075863370488.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Rick": "Thanks for reviewing the budget.  Donna's group is included in the Portfolio group numbers along with my people here on the 28th floor.  Assurance Services is the budget for the work Arthur Andersen performs reviewing RAC's controls, procedures, etc.  We are pretty much obligated to take it although we turn around and allocate the cost to the business units we serve.  As far as the presentation in concerned, we are working with the RAC VP's to get a couple of bullet points from each for their key 2002 objectives to include in the presentation.  We will wrap that up tomorrow and I will get the presentation to you to review.  Please call if you have questions.   Rick C.",
  "Sent": "Wed 8/29/2001 4:21 PM",
  "Subject": "Budget Revision 2002 for RAC",
  "To": "Buy, Rick",
  "X-FileName": "RBUY (Non-Privileged).pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\RBUY (Non-Privileged)\\Buy, Rick\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Carson, Rick L. \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=RCARSON\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "Buy-R",
  "X-To": "Buy, Rick \u003c/O=ENRON/OU=NA/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=Rbuy\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": ""

{
  "1.  VaR": "Given that PGE is a naturally short utility and does not hedge its long-dated gas position for regulatory, liquidity and market view reasons, I propose that PGE reallocate $500k of its regulated electric VaR to its regulated natural gas VaR bring the gas VaR up to $2.5MM and reducing the electric VaR to $7.5mm.  This change is necessary to account for the size of PGE's natural short position in the back-end of its reporting period. After reducing PGE's electric VaR it will still have sufficient capacity to manage the regulated electric portfolio.",
  "2. NOP": "After changing PGE's regulated gas VaR to $2.5MM it will be necessary to change the corresponding net open position.  Currently PGE has been using a 10 Bcf limit for its NOP and Maturity Gap.  Using a $2.5MM VaR I've recalculated  the corresponding NOP/Maturity limit to be approximately 17 Bcf.",
  "Cc": "Kristin Stathis",

  "Date": "Thu, 13 Sep 2001 16:45:42 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Dave": "If agreeable with you, we will remove \"See Other RAC Comments\" from the DASH template and library as an ongoing classification option.   "Given RAC's increased visability and accountability for portfolio performance, perhaps a more forceful description than \"See Other RAC Comments\" would be desirable which could be  something like": "",

{
  "?  At 10": "00 a.m. (Central) on Monday, September 17th, in Enron facilities around the world, we will have a moment of silence in memory of  those whose lives have been tragically taken.  We ask that you put down the phone, turn away from your computer and dedicate a personal moment of silence together with your co-workers.",
  "?  President Bush has declared Friday a day of \"National Prayer and Remembrance,\" and is calling on Americans to use their lunch breaks to go to places of worship to pray for victims and their families.   Following is a list of websites with additional information": "",
  "?  We will have red, white and blue striped ribbons in Houston for employees to pin on their shirts in memory of those who lost their lives, in honor of those who survived, and for their families.  Donations to the New York Firefighters and Police Officers Fund and other organizations are being accepted in exchange for the ribbons.  Enron will also match these donations.  The  ribbons are available tomorrow from 9": "00 - 11:00 a.m. at the InfoZone, which is located by the down escalator in the lobby.   For any other employees who would like to make donations, please go to the above website.",

  "o\t\u003chttp": "//www.chron.com/content/community/religious/\u003e",
  "o\tIf you are looking for a service within walking distance of the Enron building, First United Methodist Church (corner of Main and Clay) and Antioch Missionary Baptist Church will hold prayer services on Friday.  First United Methodist Church will have services at 11": "00 a.m., noon and 1:00 p.m.  Antioch Missionary Baptist Church will have a service at noon."

  "As per our discussion, the first step was to identify the participants in the retention program. The next step is to build the business case for why these employees are critical and irreplaceable to your business unit. Please provided a brief rational for why these employees were selected. Additionally, if there is a unique situation or circumstance that makes your area more vulnerable, please included in an overall business summary.   "From": "michael.tribolet@enron.com",
  "I read Gordon Bethune's comments is the Chronicle this morning and if he concerned about Continental's solvency, the other carriers must be even more at risk.   As Bill and I are traveling, could you help in asking for a recap of our Airline positions?   We probably should identify the universe of names.   Given the high operating leverage in this industry, coupled with lease leverage, it does not take much to go negative.   For United and American I would imagine access to CP and revolvers would be potentially problematic.   I will be Bill at about 6": "45 before we leave, if this is already in process, I'll leave a voice mail.",

  "From": "Buy, Rick",
  "I was just thinking of the mountain of things going on, outside of normal stuff, and I decided to make a list. Here it is": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c22453523.1075863375135.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Rick": "Good list.  As a subset of Bankruptcy Group we may want to add our efforts to foster development of consistent, accurate, Enron-wide accounts receivable aging information (Carson, Curry, Bradford).  Also, our approved 2002 budget, while allowing some limited headcount growth, may present challenges with everything on our plate.  We could discuss some potentially creative ways to lever our budget dollars.  Rick C.",

  "Subject": "Organization Changes",
  "This reorganization will allow EGS to focus our resources on opportunities that present the highest value to Enron.  It will also accomplish the following": "1) enhanced synergies among our assets and personnel, 2) more effective prioritization of business opportunities, and 3) better management of Enron's asset-based businesses throughout the world.",
  "With the creation of EGS, we hope to enhance the efficient utilization of our commercial support services.  To accomplish this, EGS' staff and operational functions will be headed by": "",

  "Length": "30 minutes",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c8938225.1075863359628.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Municipal Bond Overview Conference Call": "",
  "Notice Regarding Entry of Orders and Instructions": "Please",
  "On Wednesday, March 14, 2001, you are invited to participate in a conference call with Michael Ryan, Fixed Income Strategist for UBS PaineWebber, and John Bagley, Managing Director of the Municipal Securities Group at UBS PaineWebber. The subject of the call will be Mike Ryan's outlook on the overall municipal bond market, and the impact of President Bush's tax plan. Under Presidents Bush's proposal, the top two marginal rates would be combined into a lower 33% top bracket, while the next two rates would also be consolidated into a single 25% bracket. The 15% bracket would remain intact, but a new 10% bracket would be added. Following is the information you will need to dial into the call": "",
  "Sent": "Friday, March 09, 2001 9:26 AM",
  "Subject": "Mike Ryan/John Bagley Conference Call-Municipal Bond Market Overview",
  "Telephone#": "(800)-450-9667",
  "Time": "10:00am Central Time (11:00am EST, 8:00am PST)",
  "Title": "Mike Ryan Municipal Bond Market Overview",
  "To": "k..heathman@enron.com",

{
  "Adding Enron's \"negative CTC claim\" to the list of claims": "PGE's filing included a list of top twenty creditors.  Our negative CTC claim was apparently not taken into account in compiling that list.  The list is nonbinding, however.  PG\u0026E will be required to file schedules of creditors on April 20.  Our negative CTC claim should be on Schedule F (for unsecured claims).  You may want to remind Glynn of your previous conversations and state our expectation that the negative CTC claim will appear (preferably as uncontested) in the April 20 filing. (Note: if PG\u0026E does not include the claim we have an opportunity to file a proof of claim and ultimately the court determines the validity of the claim).",
  "Cc": "Skilling, Jeff; Whalley, Greg; Lavorato, John; Kitchen, Louise; Buy, Rick",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 9 Apr 2001 13:20:59 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Kean, Steven",
  "Including Enron on the Creditors' Committee": "PG\u0026E may have the opportunity to influence representation on the creditors' committees.  There are several reasons to suggest to Glynn that we be included: 1) we are a big creditor, 2) we could be helpful in crafting a broader solution, and 3) we are one of the real parties in interest behind the PX and ISO (who were listed as significant creditors but are really just \"passthroughs\" for the suppliers ... and PG\u0026E likely would not want to have those political bodies serving on the creditors committee anyway).",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c15061935.1075863360278.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",

  "Jim- J Block was just a gas contract. At Enron, risk is controlled through one of two mechanisms": "a book structure with approved limits and daily reporting of P\u0026L or through a one off approval of a Dash.   "Compliance": "Shelli Smith",

  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Credit Risk": "Darren Vanek",
  "Date": "Mon, 23 Jul 2001 09:06:35 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Enron Corp. Day of Caring RAC Representatives": "",
  "Enron's 2001 United Way Campaign focuses on making a difference to people severely impacted by the recent flood \"Allison\".  All business units and Corporate functions will be participating in a Day of Caring, teaming with the following United Way agencies": "Jewish Community Center, YMCA, Neighborhood Centers, and Center for the Retarded.  The Corporate functions and EGAS employees' Day of Caring is on Wednesday, August 8, 2001, and we will be teaming with the Jewish Community Center to provide assistance to senior citizen meals-on-wheels beneficiaries.  Activities that will be completed that day include painting, yard work, landscaping, cleaning, and various home repairs.",
  "From": "rick.buy@enron.com",
  "Market Risk": "Rita Hennessy",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c32791567.1075863362512.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Portfolio Management": "Becky Caudle",
  "RAC Day of Caring Team Leaders": "",
  "Subject": "DAY OF CARING - Wednesday, August 8, 2001",
  "The Jewish Community Center provides community services to individuals regardless of religious orientation.  These services include": "childcare, youth development, summer day camp, meals-on-wheels and congregate meals to the elderly, health and recreation programs, dance, drama and music programs, refugee services and other community services.  The Jewish Community Center is responsible for providing approximately 40% of Houston/Harris County meals-on-wheels per day.  Funding comes from a combination of federal and state programs, the United Way and individuals.",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 7 Aug 2001 14:33:00 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "rick.buy@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c20708189.1075863362843.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Of course, underlying all of the planned activities is the financial need that the Houston area United Way Agencies have for the Year 2002.  This year has been extraordinary due to the flooding and devastation experienced by the Houston area during Tropical Storm Alison.  In addition to providing their typical day-to-day community services, many United Way Agencies played a crucial role in the recovery effort and still provide support to those affected by the storm.  A contribution to the United Way this year is as important as ever given the extraordinary need.  Remember approximately $0.90 out of every $1.00 go directly to benefit our friends, neighbors and fellow citizens in the Houston area.  I sincerely encourage you to support RAC's objective of 100% participation in this aspect of the Campaign by making a contribution.  Contributions can be made by clicking on the Enron Human Resources website at https": "//hrglobal.enron.com.",
  "Subject": "United Way Message",
  "To": "credit.dl-rac@enron.com, mgmt.dl-rac@enron.com,",
  "To highlight this week's activities": "",

{
  "1.  VaR": "Given that PGE is a naturally short utility and does not hedge its long-dated gas position for regulatory, liquidity and market view reasons, I propose that PGE reallocate $500k of its regulated electric VaR to its regulated natural gas VaR bring the gas VaR up to $2.5MM and reducing the electric VaR to $7.5mm.  This change is necessary to account for the size of PGE's natural short position in the back-end of its reporting period. After reducing PGE's electric VaR it will still have sufficient capacity to manage the regulated electric portfolio.",
  "2. NOP": "After changing PGE's regulated gas VaR to $2.5MM it will be necessary to change the corresponding net open position.  Currently PGE has been using a 10 Bcf limit for its NOP and Maturity Gap.  Using a $2.5MM VaR I've recalculated  the corresponding NOP/Maturity limit to be approximately 17 Bcf.",

  "Enron Corporate Marketing, in conjunction with management from our core businesses, has entered into an agreement with the PacWest Racing Team for the 2001 Texaco/Havoline Grand Prix of Houston October 5-7, 2001.  The PacWest Racing Team is a member of the CART FedEx Championship Series, which features drivers Scott Dixon and Mauricio Gugelmin, and is owned by the McCaw Family (Nextel/McCaw Cellular).  Enron will be featured as a lead sponsor of the Scott Dixon #18 car, while receiving a number of other significant benefits, including": "",
  "From": "Tagliarino, David",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c12638784.1075863363575.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",

  "From": "Tajmajulie@aol.com [mailto:Tajmajulie@aol.com]",
  "I also applied for engineering dean's host today.  The application process was easy, and it kind of hurt my pride when I applied for CAS dean's host and didn't get it, so I'll see if this goes any better.  It will just entail a few hours on Fridays in the spring, and I remember that we both found the dean's hosts very helpful when we went to my freshman Friday.  But I may not get it, so oh well.  Rebecca has not woken up yet today.  It is 5": "00.  She says she has a headache.  It has been nice and quiet at least.  I returned a textbook today (went and made copies of the pages i needed to save us the 35 bucks).  I accept cash or check.  Life is good and boring.  I have been very productive the past few days, and I am happy the week is coming to an end.  I will try to have some fun this weekend.  OK that's it for now.  HOpe all's well for you.  Write or call if you're bored/depressed.  Later skat! er.",

  "As per our discussion, the first step was to identify the participants in the retention program. The next step is to build the business case for why these employees are critical and irreplaceable to your business unit. Please provided a brief rational for why these employees were selected.
